messages.msgSnippet: ... Yeah, people have good intentions when they listen to people like us complain about the fatigue, pain, depression etc. But it takes someone in the same
messages.messageBody:
Amy wrote:
>
> I think this is a great idea. I have fibromyalgia and I often have days
> (like today) when the fatigue and pain become so overwhelming, i don't think
> i'll be able to get off the couch much less hs my kids. the support from a
> list like this would be great.
> amy

Yeah, people have good intentions when they listen to people like us
complain about the fatigue, pain, depression etc. But it takes someone
in the same situation to truly sympathize with us.Only they truly know
what this kind of fatigue feels and the mental disorientation is like;
and how you can just wake up depressed after having several months of
almost all happy productive weeks and it's all part and parcel of these
diseases not because you're whacko.

What would we call such a group.
We would need a snazzy name ;-)
It would be nice to include hs'ing parents with physical disabilities as
well (wheel chair bound, cancer patients etc). They suffer the same
plight as us.

Buzz
